texts.value: Serine/threonine protein kinase which acts as a downstream effector of the second messenger cGMP

Activated by cGMP (PubMed:11834729, PubMed:11914085). The cGMP-binding domains acts cooperatively to activate PKG (PubMed:11914085). Inhibited by the antiparasitic small molecule 4-[2-(4-fluorophenyl)-5-(1-methylpiperidine-4-yl)-1Hpyrrol- 3-yl]pyridine (compound 1) (PubMed:11834729)
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. AGC Ser/Thr protein kinase family. cGMP subfamily

features.description: Loss of cooperativity between the cGMP-binding sites, however, addition of higher levels of cGMP restores normal catalytic activity; when associated with A-366. Loss of cooperativity between the cGMP-binding sites and partial loss of catalytic activity which cannot be rescued by the addition of higher levels of cGMP; when associated with A-366 and 643-A-A-644.

Loss of cooperativity between the cGMP-binding sites, however, addition of higher levels of cGMP restores normal catalytic activity; when associated with A-247. Loss of cooperativity between the cGMP-binding sites and partial loss of catalytic activity which cannot be rescued by the addition of higher levels of cGMP; when associated with A-247 and 643-A-A-644.
Partial loss of catalytic activity. Severe loss of catalytic activity; when associated with A-635.

Loss of cooperativity between the cGMP-binding sites, however, addition of higher levels of cGMP restores normal catalytic activity. Loss of cooperativity between the cGMP-binding sites and partial loss of catalytic activity which cannot be rescued by the addition of higher levels of cGMP; when associated with A-247 and A-366. Severe loss of catalytic activity; when associated with A-635.

citation.title: Purification and molecular characterization of cGMP-dependent protein kinase from Apicomplexan parasites. A novel chemotherapeutic target.
Molecular characterization of a coccidian parasite cGMP dependent protein kinase.

referencePositions: MUTAGENESIS OF MET-1; MET-48; ARG-247; ARG-366 AND 643-ARG--ARG-644
